title: Bug 3622: New Package Wizard has confusing message
description: Bug 3622: New Package Wizard has confusing message
OB: When invoking the 'New Java Package' in a Java project, the following message appears at the top: 'A folder corresponding to the package name already exists'. This message appears even when the package name field is empty. It is unclear what this message means and if it is an error. Additionally, the message is not displayed in red with the error icon.
EB: The message should not appear when the package name field is empty. If there is a folder corresponding to the package name already exists, a clearer and more informative warning message should be displayed. The warning message should be displayed in red with the error icon to indicate that it is a warning.
SR: To reproduce the issue:  1. Create a new Java project.  2. Select the project.  3. Invoke the 'New Java Package' wizard.
